title: Ambiguous documentation
body:
The following section of this [documentation](https://github.com/Netflix/security_monkey/blob/develop/docs/postgres_aws.md) is unclear:

"Create a new security group named securitymonkey-rds, and add an ingress rule on TCP 5432 to permit the securitymonkey (or whatever you named the security group that Security Monkey is launched with) security group access."

Exactly which security group am I supposed to use for the custom source on this inbound rule?

title: Every hour previously justified issues become unjustified for two iam users
body:
I noticed that every hour, all of the issues for two iam users in my account show back up under the "Aging Issues" dashboard.  When I click in on the items, all of the past justifications that I had added for the issues are gone.  I am able to add justifications again and then the issues will disappear off the "Aging Issues" dashboard until the next hour whereby my justifications will again be cleared out.   For some reason, this only seems to affect two iam users in my account, other resources seem to be fine.

This is using the code on the develop branch fetched 2-14.

title: What does the Change Emails "With Issues" option mean under notification settings?
body:
Under notification settings, I set Change Emails to be "With Issues" and set EMAIL_AUDIT_REPORTS_INCLUDE_JUSTIFIED=False in the config.  I assumed this meant it would only email me on changes with unjustified issues, however I still get emails for changes that have no issues at all (e.g. creating / deleting RDS snapshots, updating route 53 records, etc.).  Is this a bug or am I not understanding what "With issues" means?  Also, I am using the code in the develop branch fetched 2-14.

Thanks!

title: Daily emails are sent every minute of the hour
body:
## Description of issue:

When having only Daily Email enabled and Change Emails set to None, the daily email are sent every minute of the hour.  So at 11 we start to get each of the 14 auditor report emails every minute and it ends at 12.

In the logs I can find this: 2018-02-08 10:26:23,882 INFO: No Audit issues.  Not sending audit email. [in /usr/local/src/security_monkey/security_monkey/auditor.py:815]

We're using latest develop branch (last fetched 7.2.2018) and running on ECS.

title: SecurityMonkey Docker Installation Errors
body:
I am installing a local security monkey setup using the docker compose in the repository.
After executing ` monkey add_account_aws --id $account --name $name -r SecurityMonkey` , the following error are encountered:

`No command 'monkey' found, did you mean:
 Command 'donkey' from package 'donkey' (universe)
monkey: command not found`

Have i missed out some steps or I need to do something else. 
Thanks.

title: Decouple docker containers
body:
I noticed the docker containers are currently very tightly coupled:

- everything is attached to the `secmonkey-data` container
- the entrypoints for each container are located inside a volume that is mounted from the repo into the data container
- `./env-config/config-docker.py` and `./data/aws_accounts.json` are required instead of environment variables.

I would recommend the following:
- remove the data container and use bind mounts only where it's really needed (ideally, nothing except the database needs persistent data).
- include the entry point into the image itself.
- use environment variables instead of configuration files so you don't need to manually edit persistent volumes.

This would make the docker deployment a lot easier to use! :)

title: RELEASE 1.0
body:
It's been a while since the last release and there have been many new changes and updates.

There are a number of fixes that are still required:
- [x] Fix issues with the VPN watcher
- [x] Update the "Upgrading" docs to reflect the latest and greatest changes
- [x] Fix issues with the reporter emails for batched watchers (they just spam all the items the account)
- [x] Update the documentation to indicate how to enable debug logging
- [x] Investigate strange DB issues corresponding to orphaned items breaking things
- [x] Investigate Celery beat creating duplicate items. (https://github.com/celery/celery/issues/4041#issuecomment-362409863)
- [x] Update Docker files
- [x] Migrate SES sender to boto3

title: Feature Request: AWS Organization support
body: Add AWS Organization support - audit the set of Service Control Policies defined and which OU's / accounts they are bound to

title: SM item search should consider account status
body:
If you have an AWS account that you have deleted, you would tell SM not to track it by unsetting `Account.active`.

If someone was later searching with the Items table with `status == Active`, they would not expect items from deleted accounts to show up.

Right now, they will still show up unless you tell SM to delete all of these Items, which you may not want to do for forensic/historic value.

The `views/items.py` page should be updated to join on `Acccount.active = True` when `status=active/true`.

title: Feature request: Explanation of auditors
body:
Some of the checks require some expertise to understand or figure out how to fix.  For example, for S3 buckets, you can end up with "POLICY - No Policy." which has a score of zero, but what does this mean? Would there be any negative to this? How would you resolve it?  This is at https://github.com/Netflix/security_monkey/blob/c83571b671fcaa8a11f49720cba0b8a7c170b2d8/security_monkey/auditors/s3.py#L97

It's not clear to me what that is checking for.  

Ideally, for every check, there would be:
- An explanation of why this potentially bad, and why someone would do this at all.  For example, for an S3 bucket exposed publicly.
- An description of how to resolve this.
- A way to look up how you can check for the issue manually (to immediately ensure you've resolved the issue)

title: Justified Issues Score
body:
I have Justified some issue, but they still show the same score. This confuse me, becouse I though that after I justify the problem, it is acknowledge as something normal and no longer higher my score.

I would like to clean up my account with either fixing issues or justfying it, so and the end of the day I have a score or "zero". Then next day I can check what are new issues. Is there a way to achieve it ?

Thanks.

title: List of watchable resources and list of checks in the docs
body:
It sure would be great if the docs would list:

1. Which resources SM will watch and audit
2. All of the checks that are available out of the box

In order to find an answer to the second question I had to search through all of the auditor modules and count the individual check methods. By my count there are 152 checks all together, but that could easily be incorrect.

body:
I have fixed an issue where a SG was open inbound to the world, but after checking 12 hours later the issues has not gone away. I rebooted the machine, restarted the scheduler (which is running according to supervisorctl), and tried refreshing the pages. I'm on ` uname -a
Linux ip-{IP} 4.4.0-1038-aws #47-Ubuntu SMP Thu Sep 28 20:05:35 UTC 2017 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux`

```
cat /etc/lsb-release
DISTRIB_ID=Ubuntu
```

title: Unable to Send Email
body:
Hello Everyone,

I have configured Security Monkey a long time back and everything has been working just fine, I was initially receiving Emails but now I am getting the following error message in the logs:

/var/log/security_monkey/securitymonkey.log :

```
2017-09-21 11:41:45,205 WARNING: Failed to send failure message with subject: Password reset instructions
<type 'exceptions.Exception'> 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'send_email' [in /usr/local/src/security_monkey/venv/lib/python2.7/site-packages/security_monkey-0.9.3-py2.7.egg/security_monkey/common/utils.py:100]
2017-09-21 11:41:45,205 WARNING: Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/local/src/security_monkey/venv/lib/python2.7/site-packages/security_monkey-0.9.3-py2.7.egg/security_monkey/common/utils.py", line 96, in send_email
    ses.send_email(app.config.get('MAIL_DEFAULT_SENDER'), subject, html, email, format="html")
AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'send_email'
 [in /usr/local/src/security_monkey/venv/lib/python2.7/site-packages/security_monkey-0.9.3-py2.7.egg/security_monkey/common/utils.py:101]
```

Config.py:

```
# These are only required if using SMTP instead of SES
EMAILS_USE_SMTP = False     # Otherwise, Use SES
SES_REGION = 'eu-east-1'
MAIL_SERVER = 'email-smtp.eu-west-1.amazonaws.com'
MAIL_PORT = 465
MAIL_USE_SSL = True
MAIL_USERNAME = '<username>'
MAIL_PASSWORD = '<password>'
```
I have configured, Amazon SES credentials, SES creds are configured right, and I am able to send email using those credentials in another standalone python script to verify if SES creds and config are correct.

I have updated securitymonkey to latest version, all required flask packages are installed. Can't figure out what's wrong.

Any help would be appreciated!

-Ishan

title: RDS db instance watcher not paginating
body:
The watcher for RDS DB Instances is not paginating the call to describe  db instances:

https://github.com/Netflix/security_monkey/blob/develop/security_monkey/watchers/rds/rds_db_instance.py#L96

boto3 does use markers for this call:

http://boto3.readthedocs.io/en/latest/reference/services/rds.html#RDS.Client.describe_db_instances

title: Can't restart SM after log rolls
body:
The supervisor can't restart SecurityMonkey after the log rolls.
Error in supervisor log:

`ValueError: Unable to configure handler 'file': [Errno 13] Permission denied: '/var/log/security_monkey/securitymonkey.log'`

When the log rolls to .1, the new log file is created with ubuntu:ubuntu permission instead of ubuntu:www-data

```
ubuntu@ip-10-0-1-56:/var/log/security_monkey$ ls -alrt
total 10544
drwxrwxr-x 12 root   syslog       4096 Aug 25 01:17 ..
-rw-rw-r--  1 ubuntu www-data 10485725 Aug 25 17:22 securitymonkey.log.1
-rw-rw-r--  1 ubuntu ubuntu        159 Aug 25 17:23 securitymonkey.log
drwxr-xr-x  2 ubuntu www-data     4096 Aug 25 17:23 .
-rw-r--r--  1 root   root         2273 Aug 25 20:37 security_monkey.error.log
-rw-r--r--  1 root   root       284133 Aug 25 20:37 security_monkey.access.log
```

I believe this is causing the error. If I rerun the command from the setup instructions:

`sudo chown -R `whoami`:www-data /var/log/security_monkey/`

then it can restart without a problem.

I believe a `sudo chmod g+s /var/log/security_monkey` will help.

title: Enhancement: IAM policy auditor to validate security monkey role policies
body:
During upgrades, it's tedious to remember to upgrade all AWS account roles/policies with the new or changed entries needed for the new features. It would be useful to have an IAM policy auditor that checked the SecurityMonkey role and validated that the policies match the ones necessary for the current version of SecurityMonkey. An issue with score of 1, would then be emitted to alert SM admins that an AWS account was missing privileges.

I noticed that the current docs recommend adding a custom inline policy to the SecurityMonkey role, while the old docs used instructions for a SecurityMonkeyReadOnly policy. Both configurations should be supported in the new feature.

Is there a location inside the code (outside of the documentation) that has a list of the required policies needed for a particular version? Is there a process for keeping this list up to date?
